item_data:
Company: Visual Concepts (Seattle, WA)
Duration: 2024-06 to 2024-09
Description: At Visual Concepts, I developed a GPU/CPU/memory profiling toolkit for character rendering pipelines in NBA2K using OpenGL, GLSL, CUDA, and PSSL. For my first project, I built a framework to benchmark compression algorithms, successfully reducing NPC 3D model memory usage by 50% using a custom vector quantization scheme that lowered bandwidth usage by 30%. In the second project, I implemented a prototype GPU ray tracer to compare BVH layouts and constructed a mesh clustering algorithm to maximize vertex cache reuse. My CUDA kernels for BVH construction employed warp-level parallelization and shared memory, improving build times.
Tech Stack: C++, OpenGL, CUDA, GLSL, PSSL, CMake, vcpkg, Python
ranking_reason: Best fit because this candidate has demonstrated experience with CUDA and C++ in a performance-critical domain (game development). The candidate's work on GPU profiling and ray tracing, along with their mesh compression project, directly aligns with the requirements of the role. The ability to optimize code for GPU architectures and solve performance bottlenecks is highly valuable.

job_info.job_title: Developer Technology Engineer, Public Sector - New College Grad 2025
job_info.description:
NVIDIA is hiring passionate, world-class computer scientists and engineers to work in its Public Sector Developer Technology (Devtech) team! In this role, you will research and develop techniques to GPU-accelerate leading applications in fields targeting applications in the federal ecosystem. You will be performing in-depth analysis and optimization to ensure the best possible performance on current and next-generation GPU architectures.

* Working directly with key application developers to understand the current and future problems they are solving.
* Collaborating closely with diverse groups at NVIDIA.
* Occasional travel for conferences and on-site visits.
qualifications: Pursuing or recently completed a BS, MS, or PhD in CS or related discipline.
Programming fluency in C/C++ and/or Fortran.
Strong math fundamentals including linear algebra and numerical methods.
Experience with parallel programming, ideally CUDA C/C++ and OpenACC.
Domain expertise in data analytics, signal processing, or deep learning.
Experience working with the Federal Government and ability to hold a US security clearance.

bullet_points: Developed a GPU/CPU profiling toolkit for NBA2K character rendering pipelines by implementing CUDA and OpenGL, which enabled detailed performance analysis and optimization.
Engineered a mesh compression system using custom vector quantization, resulting in a 50% reduction in 3D model memory usage and a 30% decrease in bandwidth usage.
Implemented a prototype GPU ray tracer using CUDA, constructing a mesh clustering algorithm that maximized vertex cache reuse, improving rendering efficiency.
